newsitem.title: USA: Mississippi River night use restrictions increased.
newsitem.headline: Mississippi River night use restrictions increased.

text.p: One-way vessel traffic on the Mississippi River in the vicinity of a barge accident has been further restricted to northbound traffic until daylight Thursday, a spokesman at the Coast Guard on-scene command center said Wednesday night.
Earlier in the afternoon one-way traffic, one vessel at a time, was permitted in both directions.
The river just north of Baton Rouge was closed Monday after a tow with 25 barges hit a bridge, sinking two rock barges and capsizing a tanker barge carrying a mix of gasoline and benzene.
Wednesday afternoon the river was opened to one-way traffic under Coast Guard supervision. The spokesman said plans are continuing to lighter the capsized barge before righting it.
"We hope to begin lightering Thursday morning," he said.
In addition to hampering the flow of vessels on the river, the barge accident forced the indefinite closure of two gambling riverboats, the Belle of Baton Rouge and Casino Rouge.
